title: 'Make up your mind on what kind of ties you want,' Jaishankar tells Dhaka
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar urged Bangladesh to decide on the nature of their relationship with India, highlighting issues of blame and minority attacks. He emphasized the importance of clear intentions for the future while acknowledging the historical ties between the two nations.

title: AAP government has left 'entire exchequer empty': Delhi CM Rekha Gupta
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta assured that despite the empty state coffers left by the previous AAP government, the BJP is committed to implementing the Rs 2,500-per month honorarium scheme for eligible women. Approximately 38 lakh women could benefit from this scheme, which is projected to cost over Rs 11,000 crore annually. The assembly session will prioritize development projects and address misuse of funds in previous reports.

title: Watch: How Italian jets escorted American Airlines flight to Rome after bomb threat
content: A bomb threat on an American Airlines flight from New York to Delhi led to its diversion to Rome, where it was escorted by Italian fighter jets and inspected. The threat was deemed non-credible, but security protocols necessitated the diversion. The aircraft was cleared and re-departed after an overnight stay for crew rest.

title: Who are the 10 people PM Modi chose to lead the fight against obesity?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi nominated ten prominent figures to lead a campaign against obesity and excessive edible oil consumption. This initiative follows his 'Mann Ki Baat' address urging a 10% reduction in oil intake. Nominations include influential personalities like Anand Mahindra, Mirabai Chanu, and Sudha Murty, aiming to spread health awareness and motivate others to join the movement.

title: German elections 2025: What is AfD and why is it trending?
content: The Alternative for Germany party (AfD) emerged as the second-largest political force in Germany, securing around 20% of the vote. Despite efforts to halve its support, the AfD's anti-immigration stance resonated with many voters. However, coalition prospects look slim, with the CDU ruling out collaboration due to major policy differences.

title: Infosys co-founder: You can have all the AIs in the world, but ...
content: Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani highlighted that artificial intelligence will not replace core human traits like empathy, leadership, creativity, and collaboration. Speaking at an AIMA event, he emphasized the importance of developing adaptable skills and predicted significant AI advancements in India in the coming year.

title: Kohli’s Masterclass: Another chase, another ton, another win
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. His clinical run-chase, characterized by calculated playing and minimizing risks, showcased his prowess. Kohli's fitness and strategic striking in the middle overs were key. He emphasized maintaining focus and energy, aiming to rest before facing New Zealand.

title: Watch: Israeli jets that allegedly killed Nasrallah hover over his funeral gathering
content: Israeli warplanes circled over Beirut during Hezbollah leader Sheikh Hassan Nasrallah's funeral in a show of force. Defence Minister Israel Katz confirmed it as a message to those who threaten Israel. Nasrallah, killed in an Israeli airstrike, led Hezbollah for over three decades.

title: Virat Kohli surpasses Ricky Ponting in all-time run-scorer list
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, cementing their place in the semifinals. Kohli's unbeaten 100 not only secured the win but also made him the third-highest run-scorer in international cricket, surpassing Ricky Ponting. He became the fastest to reach 14,000 ODI runs, continuing to set new records.

title: Founder complains about DocuSign's high cost; Zoho’s Sridhar Vembu replies
content: Andrew Wilkinson questioned the high pricing of DocuSign, sparking responses about bloated SaaS costs. Zoho's Sridhar Vembu criticized DocuSign for overpricing and suggested evaluating vendors' sales versus R&D expenses as a cost-saving measure, asserting that enterprises won't always pay high brand premiums.

title: 6 dead, 2 injured as jeep carrying Maha Kumbh returnees collides with bus
content: A tragic road accident in Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, on Monday morning resulted in six fatalities when a vehicle collided with a bus. The identities of the victims are yet to be confirmed. Another accident occurred in Mauganj district on Sunday, killing three Maharashtra residents after attending the Mahakumbh. Emergency responders and authorities are probing the causes of both incidents.

title: Rs 7 crore timepiece! Hardik Pandya's watch steals the spotlight
content: Hardik Pandya’s impressive bowling helped India defeat Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025, but his $800,000 Richard Mille RM 27-02 watch also grabbed attention. The rare timepiece, designed for Rafael Nadal, features cutting-edge technology. Pandya's 2 for 31 performance, including Babar Azam's wicket, combined with Virat Kohli's masterclass sealed the win for India.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex crashes over 500 points; Nifty50 below 22,650
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in opening trade on Monday. While BSE Sensex dipped over 500 points, Nifty50 went below 22,650.

title: Elon Musk on former Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal: 'fired...got nothing done…'
content: Elon Musk criticized former X CEO Parag Agrawal for lack of productivity, leading to his dismissal after Musk's acquisition. Musk's Department of Government Efficiency ordered federal employees to justify their work weekly, sparking backlash and union opposition, emphasizing the tension with the Trump administration.

title: Who is Alice Weidel? Germany’s gay, far-right AfD leader
content: Alice Weidel, a gay woman with a Sri Lankan partner, leads Germany's far-right AfD, which opposes same-sex marriage and champions traditional values. Her leadership has bolstered the AfD's support. Despite criticism for her anti-immigration stance and controversial views, she remains influential in German politics, urging stricter immigration laws and a referendum on EU membership.

title: Jilted lover goes on rampage in Bengaluru, torches 3 cars & damages bike
content: In south Bengaluru, three cars were torched and a motorbike was severely damaged in a suspected act of revenge by a man identified as Rahul, a known criminal. The vehicles, belonging to a girl's family, were set on fire allegedly because the girl had distanced herself from Rahul, prompting him to act out violently.

title: CT Digest: Virat Kohli's masterclass sinks Pakistan; NZ eye semis
content: Virat Kohli's sensational unbeaten century led India to a commanding six-wicket win over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, placing them atop Group A. Kohli's innings, achieving a key milestone of 14,000 ODI runs, ensures India’s strong position. Attention now turns to the New Zealand vs Bangladesh match, pivotal for semifinal qualifications.

title: Top stock recommendations for the week starting February 24, 2025
content: Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd recommends Hindalco and UltraTech as top stock picks for the week of February 24, 2025. Hindalco showcases strong earnings growth and expansion plans, while UltraTech benefits from industry leadership, high utilization rates, and recovering cement demand.

title: Who is Friedrich Merz? The conservative set to become Germany's new chancellor
content: The Christian Democratic Union (CDU) is poised to win the German election, with Friedrich Merz set to become the new chancellor. The ruling Social Democrats are seeing a decline, while the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) is gaining ground. Merz, known for his firm stance on asylum-seekers and business background, aims to strengthen Europe's security.

title: Sag Awards 2025: Complete list of winners
content: The 31st Annual SAG Awards in Los Angeles celebrated exceptional performances in film and television. Timothée Chalamet and Demi Moore were among the big winners. 'A Complete Unknown' and 'Shōgun' took top honors in their respective categories. The star-studded event recognized outstanding achievements in acting.

title: Drones used in Manipur violence were procured from Delhi, Haryana: NIA
content: NIA has identified suppliers of drones used in attacks at Koutruk and Kadangband in Manipur last year. Mayank Sharma and Vikram Chaudhary provided the drones and accessories. Khaigoulen Kipgen collected them after paying a substantial amount. The attacks, executed by suspected Kuki militants, involved 40 bombs dropped via drones, resulting in one death and injuries.

title: Deported by US to Panama, 12 illegal migrants reach India
content: A group of 12 undocumented Indian immigrants deported from the US to Panama reached Delhi, facilitated by the International Organisation for Migration. This comes after the deportation of 332 others to Amritsar earlier this month. Cases have been registered against travel agents responsible for illegal facilitation.

title: Virat Kohli loves representing the country: Rohit Sharma
content: India captain Rohit Sharma dismissed concerns about his hamstring after taking a break during India's crucial six-wicket win over Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century drove India to victory, while bowlers like Kuldeep and Axar played a key role in restricting Pakistan to 241.

title: Trump administration fires 2,000 USAID workers, puts thousands on leave
content: The Trump administration has cut 2,000 positions at USAID and placed remaining staff on administrative leave after a federal court allowed the move. This decision is part of a larger effort to scale back USAID operations, which has already led to the closure of its headquarters and numerous global aid programs.

title: 'I bear responsibility': German chancellor Olaf Scholz on election defeat
content: Germany's national elections saw Olaf Scholz's SPD defeated, with Friedrich Merz's CDU/CSU alliance winning over 28% of the vote. The far-right AfD surged to second place with 20%, while coalition talks remain uncertain. The election results have raised concerns over Germany’s future direction, with significant implications for its defense policy and European unity.

title: Pope Francis develops 'initial, slight insufficiency' in kidney function
content: Pope Francis has demonstrated an initial, mild insufficiency in kidney function, as per a Vatican update. He remains alert and is receiving high-flow oxygen therapy. Since last evening, there have been no further respiratory crises, and his hemoglobin levels have risen following a transfusion. The condition is critical but stable with continuous monitoring.

title: 70 rescued from cybercrime hub in Myanmar, await return to India
content: Around 70 Indians, including five women, were rescued from a cybercrime hub in Myanmar and moved to Thailand by Myanmar’s armed forces. The victims, hailing from various Indian states, had been coerced into cybercriminal activities, and authorities are now coordinating their return to India.

title: Virat Kohli is always hungry for runs: Shreyas Iyer
content: India secured a crucial victory against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy, boosting their semifinal chances. Shreyas Iyer's pivotal 56 runs and Kohli's century were key contributors. Iyer praised the team's strategy and spinners' performance while dismissing injury concerns for Rohit Sharma and Mohammed Shami.

title: 'We have achieved something historic': Germany's AfD celebrates record gains
content: Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party achieved a historic milestone, surging to over 20% in national election results, trailing only the CDU/CSU alliance. Chancellor Olaf Scholz's SPD faced a significant setback, finishing third with just over 16%, while AfD leaders challenge mainstream parties on future cooperation.

title: Germany elections: Friedrich Merz claims victory for his conservatives
content: German elections see opposition leader Friedrich Merz claiming victory, with the far-right Alternative for Germany achieving its strongest showing since World War II. The results indicate complications in forming a coalition, with potential partners required for Merz to secure governance.

title: ‘Chhaava’ collection day 10: Closes second weekend with Rs 326.75 crore
content: Vicky Kaushal's historical drama 'Chhaava', directed by Laxman Utekar, reached ₹326.75 crore in India after its second weekend. The film, chronicling Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj's life, earned ₹44 crore on its second Saturday and ₹40 crore on its second Sunday. It also received praise from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, adding to its soaring popularity.

title: Outflows from FIIs touch Rs 1.1 lakh crore in 2025
content: Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold Rs 1.1 lakh crore in Indian equities in 2025, causing a 4% decline in Nifty year-to-date. High valuations and weak corporate earnings led to profit booking, with China's market gains drawing FIIs away from Indian stocks.

title: NFL Combine 2025: Dates, times, channels, and streaming details
content: The 2025 NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis, from February 27 to March 2, will feature 300 top prospects competing for 256 draft slots. Key players include Heisman winner Travis Hunter. Fans can watch on NFL Network, NFL+, or Fubo. Ohio State leads with 15 invited players. The event promises intense competition and excitement.

title: Pakistan's Champions Trophy dream 'ended' by India: Rizwan
content: Pakistan captain Mohammad Rizwan conceded that his team's hopes of winning the Champions Trophy had ended following a defeat to India. Rizwan expressed disappointment in relying on other teams' results to advance and admitted that repeated mistakes led to their downfall. Pakistan is set to play Bangladesh next.

title: Centre bans manufacture & export of 2 drugs 'fuelling' W Africa opioid crisis
content: Maharashtra's Aveo Pharmaceuticals was raided by state and central drug inspectors following a BBC documentary exposing their illegal export of unlicensed, addictive opioid pills to West Africa, leading to halted production and seized inventory. Authorities issued stricter export and manufacturing directives in response.

title: Lured by fake job offers, then forced to defraud US-based NRIs
content: Indian nationals were deceived with false job offers in Myanmar and forced into scamming US-based NRIs using various fraud tactics. They faced severe punishments, including electric shocks, if they didn't comply. The operations involved impersonation and complex coordination between different scam centers.

title: Those with ‘slave mentality’ attacking India’s traditions with foreign help: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized opposition leaders for mocking Hindu religious practices and cultural traditions, accusing them of divisive agendas supported by foreign powers. He emphasized unity and announced significant healthcare initiatives, including a new cancer hospital in Madhya Pradesh and district-wide cancer centers nationwide within three years.

title: Facing lawyers’ ire, government withdraws draft advocates bill
content: The law ministry has withdrawn the draft Advocates (Amendment) Bill, 2025 from public consultation after facing threats of protests from lawyers' bodies. The bill proposed disciplinary actions, including revoking licenses for disrupting court proceedings, and allowed foreign law firms to practice in India.

title: FinMin: India was working on 7 projects with USAID
content: India has been implementing seven projects worth $750 million in collaboration with USAID. The focus is on agriculture, climate adaptation, water and sanitation, renewable energy, health, and disaster management. Ongoing since 1951, USAID has provided $17 billion over 73 years for 555 projects across multiple sectors.

title: US reciprocal tariffs may hit exports of India-made iPhones, auto parts
content: Apple and auto component makers face potentially significant losses if the Trump administration imposes reciprocal tariffs on electronics and smartphones imported from India. This move could disrupt Apple's manufacturing investments, which currently benefit from zero import duties in the US, and impact the competitive edge of India's electronics and auto components exports.

title: Language logjam keeps K’taka, Maha govt buses stalled; thousands affected
content: Inter-state government bus services between Karnataka and Maharashtra remain suspended indefinitely due to linguistic tensions. The suspension follows assaults on transport personnel from both states, involving language disputes. Thousands of commuters are affected, with alternative travel arrangements being sought amid heightened security concerns.

title: Shashi Tharoor's growing rift with Congress brass sparks speculation
content: Shashi Tharoor, a prominent Congress MP, has shown signs of growing dissatisfaction with the party, citing a leadership gap in Kerala Congress and seeking clarity on his role. Despite this, Kerala Congress leaders believe Tharoor will stay with the party. Tharoor has expressed interest in the chief minister role if Congress wins the Kerala assembly elections.

title: Trump congratulates Merz for becoming next Chancellor of Germany
content: US President Donald Trump hailed the conservative alliance's victory in Germany's election, criticizing the Scholz regime's policy on energy and immigration. Friedrich Merz, set to become the next chancellor, plans a strict stance on undocumented migration, social welfare tourism, and crime, signaling a rightward shift.

title: Hand over temples to shrine bodies, scrap government control, says Kanchi seer
content: Jagadguru Shri Shankara Vijayendra Saraswathi, the 70th Acharya of Shri Kanchi Kamakoti Peetam, advocates for the return of temples and their property to their respective authorities, urging the government to relinquish control. He emphasizes the importance of using temple incomes to propagate Sanatan Dharma, educate pupils in Vedas, and support traditional initiatives, while involving youth and preparing for the next Maha Kumbh.

title: India, UK trade talks: Focus on scotch, visas
content: Negotiations for the UK-India free trade agreement restart under the new UK government, focusing on duty cuts for Scotch and cars, and easier visas for Indian professionals. Concessions are being discussed, with India seeking better business visa terms and a fair treatment of its spirits in the UK market.

title: BJP peddling 'fake news' from America, indulging in 'anti-national work': Cong
content: Congress has accused BJP of spreading fake news by claiming that USAID funds intended for India were used for voter turnout. They also criticized BJP for remaining silent on US President Trump and Elon Musk's insults towards India to secure a pardon for Adani, who faces cases in America.

title: Assam Rifles seizes over 622kg of explosives in Aizawl, 3 held
content: Assam Rifles personnel intercepted a vehicle in Aizawl, seizing 4,980 sticks of explosives weighing approximately 622.5kg, and arrested three individuals. The seized explosives were suspected to be procured by the Bangladesh-based insurgent group PCJSS. The arrested individuals and the explosives were handed over to Vaivakawn police station officials.

title: Telangana tunnel collapse: Team Silkyara joins rescue operation
content: Rescue efforts are underway to save eight workers, including two engineers, trapped in a collapsed section of the Srisailam Left Bank Canal tunnel in Telangana. Silt and water are hindering progress, and additional equipment and expertise have been brought in to accelerate the operation, amidst fears of debris complicating the rescue.

title: Sources: 76ers, Embiid exploring options for knee
content: The 76ers and Joel Embiid are consulting doctors and considering alternative options, such as surgery, to treat his injured knee, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: QB Sanders won't work out at combine
content: Colorado quarterback Shedeur Sanders will not work out at the scouting combine in Indianapolis this week, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ovechkin nets 3, now 13 goals shy of NHL record
content: Alex Ovechkin scored his 880th, 881st and 882nd career goals to move 13 goals from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record and give the Washington Capitals a 7-3 victory over the Edmonton Oilers on Sunday.

title: Mystics deal All-Star Atkins to Sky for No. 3 pick
content: The Mystics on Sunday traded two-time All-Star guard Ariel Atkins to the Sky in exchange for the No. 3 pick in the 2025 WNBA draft and two other 2027 selections.

title: Robertson brothers combine for 5 goals in 2 wins
content: Jason and Nicholas Robertson are the first set of brothers to score multiple goals on the same day since Pavel and Valeri Bure in March 2000.

title: Despite invite, Venus 'not playing' Indian Wells
content: During an appearance in Denmark on Sunday, former world No. 1 Venus Williams said she would not play at the upcoming BNP Paribas Open in California, a decision the tournament confirmed in a social media post, adding that "we wish Venus all the best."

title: Expansion San Diego beats Galaxy in MLS opener
content: Anders Dreyer scored a brace and Carlos Dos Santos recorded three saves for his first career clean sheet as visiting San Diego FC stunned defending MLS champ LA Galaxy 2-0 on Sunday in the season-opening match for both teams.

title: Bieber, Carell skate in benefit game for L.A. fires
content: Musician Justin Bieber was among a host of celebrities who laced up their skates, along with Hockey Hall of Famer Mark Messier, on Sunday afternoon to support relief funds for the Los Angeles fires in the "Skate for LA Strong" event at Crypto.com Arena.

title: How NC State upset No. 1 Notre Dame and how it impacts NCAA seeds and more
content: The Wolfpack guards outplayed their Irish counterparts to climb to a 2-seed. Is Notre Dame still a No. 1?

title: Easy win shows Emma Hayes' USWNT rebuild is going masterfully
content: If the SheBelieves Cup was an opportunity to get a gage on Hayes' rebuild, Sunday's win showed that the USWNT are right on track.

title: WNBA trade grades: Ariel Atkins a good fit, but did Sky give up too much?
content: Chicago got Ariel Atkins, a strong fit. But the Sky gave up a lot to the Mystics, who now have three of the top six picks this April.

title: Liverpool might've just won the Premier League, and Man City let them
content: Have Liverpool and Salah just ended the Premier League title race? Man City look like a shadow of themselves, and De Bruyne is fading fast.

title: Ukraine's wounded find love, hope in soccer: 'Shakhtar is bringing me back to life'
content: The players on Shakhtar Stalevi, a team of Ukrainian amputees formed in 2024, have been greatly impacted by the full-scale Russian invasion. But they've gained a purpose and new life through soccer.

title: 'He thought of everything': How Mookie Betts' offseason could cement him at shortstop
content: After an interrupted attempt last year, Betts is again the Dodgers' starting shortstop -- and this time he has a plan.

title: Just months after puncture wound injury, Mikaela Shiffrin shows why she's the GOAT
content: Mikaela Shiffrin once again proves she's the greatest -- and perhaps the most resilient athlete of all time too -- winning her 100th World Cup title.

title: Salah: Liverpool's 'big guys' need another title
content: Mohamed Salah said Liverpool's modern-day legends "need another title" after they swatted aside Manchester City at the Etihad on Sunday.

title: Pep: I saw City's 'bright future' in loss to Liverpool
content: Pep Guardiola said he saw Manchester City's "bright future" despite watching his young team lose to Liverpool at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday.

title: Ancelotti on Modric after stunner: 'Gift for football'
content: Carlo Ancelotti described Luka Modric as "a gift to football" after the midfielder, 39, scored a spectacular goal in Real Madrid's 2-0 win over Girona on Sunday.

title: Moise Kean hospitalized after head injury collapse
content: Fiorentina striker Moise Kean was taken to hospital on Sunday after collapsing with a head injury during his team's defeat against Hellas Verona.

title: Mascherano hails Messi as Miami's 'soul' in draw
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano has praised his team for its "soul" after it overcame a first-half red card to earn a draw against New York City FC at Chase Stadium on Saturday to kick off the 2025 MLS season.

title: Bayern crush Frankfurt to restore 8-point lead
content: Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich powered past third-placed Eintracht Frankfurt 4-0 with an impressive display of high pressing football on Sunday to restore their eight point lead in the Bundesliga over second-placed Bayer Leverkusen.

title: Isak's 50th PL goal helps Newcastle edge Forest
content: Newcastle United scored four goals in 11 first-half minutes to keep alive their Champions League qualification hopes with a thrilling 4-3 victory over Nottingham Forest at St James' Park on Sunday but had to hold on under heavy pressure in the second...

title: Wrexham top Mansfield to continue promotion push
content: Wrexham moved maintained their push for promotion from League 1 with a 2-1 win over Mansfield Town on Sunday.

title: Christopher Bell uses overtime to win 10th NASCAR Cup race
content: Christopher Bell, who led only the final lap in his Joe Gibbs Racing Toyota, edged Carson Hocevar and Kyle Larson in overtime Sunday in a close NASCAR Cup Series finish at Atlanta Motor Speedway, giving the 30-year-old Oklahoma driver 10 career Cup wins.

title: Yin triumphs at LPGA Thailand despite Iwai's 61
content: Angel Yin made seven birdies in a bogey-free final round to hold off a fast-finishing Akie Iwai to win the LPGA Thailand tournament by one shot.

title: Beterbiev-Bivol takeaways: Trilogy fight should happen before Canelo, Benavidez
content: Dmitry Bivol vs. Artur Beterbiev 2 was as good, if not better, than their first fight. Let's finish the trilogy now before other big bouts get in the way.

title: Has international hockey replaced the NHL All-Star Game for good?
content: The 4 Nations Face-Off was a game-changer. How will the NHL capitalize on it -- and what comes next for its midseason events?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye £85m deal for Guimarães
content: Is Bruno Guimarães set to make the move from Newcastle to Manchester City? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: After a day-long effort, rescuers said they were 150 metres away from the accident site, with muck and debris hindering progress

content: The Nepal government has also expressed concern that their students may be subjected to reprisal if the "unruly" teachers and staff members remain in the institute

title: PM Modi nominates Omar Abdullah, Anand Mahindra, Mohanlal for campaign against obesity
content: Bhojpuri singer-actor Nirahua, shooting champion Manu Bhaker, weightlifter Mirabai Chanu, Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani, actor R. Madhavan, singer Shreya Ghoshal and philanthropist and MP Sudha Murty are the other personalities nominated by PM Modi to help fight obesity.

content: Two others suffered injuries and they were referred to Jabalpur medical college after initial treatment at a medical facility in Sihora town, the official said

content: “It is not possible to change the aircraft seats in a short span of two years. Cushions are replaced on a regular basis once their life is over,” industry official explained

content: Vijayendra was replying to a question on the attack on a KSRTC bus driver and conductor in Belagavi allegedly for not speaking in Marathi

content: What are the suggestive parameters introduced by the University Grants Commission with respect to academic journals? Will it lead to a proliferation of low quality journals?

content: Hyderabad-based magician Samala Venu has given over 7,000 performances across India and in over 30 countries, and is also credited with starting a Diploma in Magic course for the first time in the country

title: Group-II Mains conducted smoothly, attendance percentage stands at 92
content: The exam, comprising two papers and conducted by the Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission for recruitment to the posts under Group-II services, recorded an overall attendance of 92%.

title: Maha Kumbh: 13 FIRs registered against 140 social media handles for misleading content
content: “13 FIRs have been registered against 140 social media handles that shared misleading content”, said Maha Kumbh Deputy Inspector General of Police

title: Farmers to gherao Assembly on April 15 if Parandur airport project is not dropped
content: CPI (M) State president  P. Shanmugam reminded the ruling DMK of its poll promise of not using agricultural lands for development projects without the consent of farmers.

title: Maharashtra Congress chief Sapkal raises concern over cannabis cultivation in Buldhana, seeks probe
content: According to reports, authorities confiscated cannabis plants worth more than ₹12.6 crore from a farm and arrested a farmer.

title: 38% of fatal crashes in Mumbai in 2023 hit-and-run cases: report
content: Mumbai reported 374 deaths in 351 road crashes in 2023, marking a 39% decrease since 2015, as per a report.

title: Maharashtra to give additional ₹50K subsidy for rural homes under PMAY
content: With this, a beneficiary will get a total financial support of Rs. 2.1 lakh; Minister highlights govt.’s commitment to complete 20 lakh housing units, the largest target in the country, within a year; first tranche for 10 lakh units distributed on Saturday, Febuary 22, 2025

title: NIMS Medical Genetics Department: A beacon of hope for rare disease patients
content: The department treats a spectrum of rare conditions, including Gaucher Disease, Homocystinuria, Growth Hormone Deficiency, Methylmalonic Acidemia, Wilson Disease, Phenylketonuria, and Pompe Disease, among others

title: Assault on NWKRTC conductor: Ramalinga Reddy to visit Belagavi on February 24
content: It may be noted that bus services across the border have been suspended by both States as part of safety measures soon after the assault.

title: Pawan chairs meeting of party MLAs on eve of budget session
content: Pawan Kalyan exhorted the MLAs to make the most of the time given to them, by highlighting the problems faced by the people

title: 2 injured in celebratory firing during wedding in Noida
content: Some people in the wedding procession fired in the air at around 10 p.m. and the bullets hit Santosh (45) and Dayal (23).

title: XR Creator Hackathon throws open opportunities for myriad aspirants
content: The XR Creator Hackathon is being organised by Wavelaps in association with the WAVES 2025 initiative of the Ministry

title: Maharashtra budget to be presented on March 10
content: During the Budget Session, the Legislative Assembly will function on Saturday, March 8, which is a public holiday.

title: Haryana municipal elections a low-key affair for JJP, INLD, AAP
content: More than 600 wards up for grabs in polls slated for March 2; JJP in revamp mode; AAP facing internal strife; INLD, with mostly rural vote bank, has left decision to contest polls to its district units

content: Unearthed objects, crafted primarily from brass and other alloys, include intricately shaped figurines and ritualistic items

content: Most of the shelves wore an empty look on Sunday as hundreds of students and youngsters, in tow with their parents, swarmed the Grandhalayam to grab a book of their choice

title: Grameen Bharat Mahotsav sees sales of products over ₹54 lakh
content: The 10-day exhibition organised by NABARD comes to a close;  products that attracted eyeballs include leather puppetry products, handwoven cotton sarees from Narayanpet in Telangana, banana fibre products, Kondapalli toys, Kalamkari textiles, Venkatagiri sarees, Etikoppaka toys, among others

title: ‘Idhayam’: a love story starring Murali that was close to the heart of Madras
content: Late actor Murali’s son, Atharvaa, will play the lead in Idhayam Murali, a romantic drama that is an obvious hat-tip to the love stories Murali headlined in the 1990s

title: Kuki National Organisation spokesperson removed from DU Lit Fest panel
content: Seilen Haokip says he was asked to leave 15 minutes before the panel was scheduled to begin, after being informed that his participation has been “politicised”

title: Bank that had a humble beginning has more than 3,000 branches
content: Registered as a joint stock bank on November 20, 1936, in Madras, the financial institution was aimed at promoting overseas banking and facilitating foreign exchange operations. As of December 31, 2024, it had a customer base of 4 crore and 21,147 employees

content: Flight tracking website claims a bomb threat was the reason for the diversion but there has been official statement from the airline

title: Harrowing time for commuters as snag hits ro-ro ferry
content: Demand for local repair facilities to avoid delays in  service restoration of ferries grows louder; steps sought to redevelop Vypeen Jetty

content: RSS chief said that sustained communal harmony among various ethnic groups in society, and goodwill among  relatives and clans, would lead the nation towards positive direction and outcomes

title: Shelar-led delegation off to Paris to obtain UNESCO heritage status for 12 forts of Shivaji
content: Delegation to present the case under the concept of Maratha Military Landscape of India, hopes to bring global recognition to Maharashtra’s cultural heritage

title: Pawan chairs meeting of party MLAs on eve of budget session

title: 'Brainless and clueless': Akhtar and Akram slam Pak management after loss to India
content: Shoaib Akhtar and Wasim Akram criticised Pakistan's team management after their six-wicket loss to India in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Akhtar described the management as 'brainless and clueless' for poor team selection, while Akram emphasised the need for drastic changes to rebuild the team. Both expressed concern over Pakistan's bowling performance and leadership.

title: Telangana tunnel collapse: Minister says chances of survival 'very remote'
content: Eight individuals remain trapped in the SLBC tunnel after its partial collapse in Telangana. Despite rescue efforts involving rat miners and equipment, the chances of survival appear very slim due to significant debris and lack of oxygen. The operation may take three to four days.

title: 2 injured in celebratory firing during wedding in Noida
content: Some people in the wedding procession fired in the air at around 10 p.m. and the bullets hit Santosh (45) and Dayal (23).

title: XR Creator Hackathon throws open opportunities for myriad aspirants
content: The XR Creator Hackathon is being organised by Wavelaps in association with the WAVES 2025 initiative of the Ministry

title: Virat Kohli on what it means to play against Pakistan - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's candid reflection on his century against Pakistan highlights the dual-edged nature of his favorite cover drive shot, which is both a weakness and a scoring tool. In the ICC Champions Trophy match, he emphasizes the balance between minimizing risks and ensuring team victory, especially in high-stakes matches against archrivals.

title: 'Make up your mind on what kind of ties you want,' Jaishankar tells Dhaka
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar urged Bangladesh to decide on the nature of their relationship with India, highlighting issues of blame and minority attacks. He emphasized the importance of clear intentions for the future while acknowledging the historical ties between the two nations.

title: Infosys co-founder: You can have all the AIs in the world, but ...
content: Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani highlighted that artificial intelligence will not replace core human traits like empathy, leadership, creativity, and collaboration. Speaking at an AIMA event, he emphasized the importance of developing adaptable skills and predicted significant AI advancements in India in the coming year.

title: Maharashtra budget to be presented on March 10
content: During the Budget Session, the Legislative Assembly will function on Saturday, March 8, which is a public holiday.

title: India’s GDP may take 0.1-0.6% hit from US tariff moves
content: India's GDP may be impacted by proposed US tariffs raising by an estimated 0.1 to 0.6 percentage points, as per Goldman Sachs analysis. The potential rise in tariffs by 6.5 to 11.5 percentage points on Indian imports may significantly affect India's trade dynamics with the US.

title: 'Dil ke armaan ...': Shoaib Malik expresses frustration with song - Watch
content: Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik expressed his frustration after Pakistan's six-wicket loss to India by singing a classic song during a panel discussion. The legendary pace trio of Wasim Akram, Waqar Younis and Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan's poor batting and lack of discipline. Pakistan are now on the brink of elimination from the Champions Trophy.

title: Tangra deaths: Why cops are not convinced by Dey brothers’ suicide story
content: Prasun Dey, soon to be discharged from the hospital, will join his brother Pranay at NRS Medical College for questioning. Investigations focus on whether they force-fed poison to Priyamvada and details surrounding their planned suicide. Prasun's recovery is critical for the probe as police aim to fill gaps in the case.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk gives ‘bankruptcy’ warning for California
content: Elon Musk warns California could face bankruptcy without significant changes, citing concerns about high government spending and business regulations. Musk moved Tesla's headquarters to Texas due to California's challenges. He also emphasized that the U.S. needs drastic budget cuts, stressing it's essential to avoid national bankruptcy.

title: Haryana municipal elections a low-key affair for JJP, INLD, AAP
content: More than 600 wards up for grabs in polls slated for March 2; JJP in revamp mode; AAP facing internal strife; INLD, with mostly rural vote bank, has left decision to contest polls to its district units

content: Unearthed objects, crafted primarily from brass and other alloys, include intricately shaped figurines and ritualistic items

content: Most of the shelves wore an empty look on Sunday as hundreds of students and youngsters, in tow with their parents, swarmed the Grandhalayam to grab a book of their choice

content: The 10-day exhibition organised by NABARD comes to a close;  products that attracted eyeballs include leather puppetry products, handwoven cotton sarees from Narayanpet in Telangana, banana fibre products, Kondapalli toys, Kalamkari textiles, Venkatagiri sarees, Etikoppaka toys, among others

title: Germany turns right: Election results explained in 9 graphics
content: Voters turned out in record numbers for the German election. Here’s a look in charts at the wins and losses, seats in parliament, possible coalition outcomes and voter demographics.

title: 'Kohinoor' Virat Kohli will score another 10 to 15 hundreds: Sidhu
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu is confident that Virat Kohli will continue his career for another 2-3 years following his recent performance. Kohli's unbeaten century against Pakistan highlights his resilience and determination, setting expectations for more centuries in the coming years.

content: Prafull Billore, the founder of MBA Chaiwala, humorously challenges IITian Baba's prediction about India's victory over Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. Known for his viral 'Panauti' memes, Billore's playful antics on social media have continued to entertain fans amidst India's cricketing triumphs.

title: Watch: How Italian jets escorted American Airlines flight to Rome after bomb threat
content: A bomb threat on an American Airlines flight from New York to Delhi led to its diversion to Rome, where it was escorted by Italian fighter jets and inspected. The threat was deemed non-credible, but security protocols necessitated the diversion. The aircraft was cleared and re-departed after an overnight stay for crew rest.

title: Who are the 10 people PM Modi chose to lead the fight against obesity?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi nominated ten prominent figures to lead a campaign against obesity and excessive edible oil consumption. This initiative follows his 'Mann Ki Baat' address urging a 10% reduction in oil intake. Nominations include influential personalities like Anand Mahindra, Mirabai Chanu, and Sudha Murty, aiming to spread health awareness and motivate others to join the movement.

title: Sensex crashes 800 points; why stock market is falling today
content: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, plunged in trade on Monday. While BSE Sensex tanked over 800 points, Nifty50 went below 22,600.

title: ‘Idhayam’: a love story starring Murali that was close to the heart of Madras
content: Late actor Murali’s son, Atharvaa, will play the lead in Idhayam Murali, a romantic drama that is an obvious hat-tip to the love stories Murali headlined in the 1990s

title: Kuki National Organisation spokesperson removed from DU Lit Fest panel
content: Seilen Haokip says he was asked to leave 15 minutes before the panel was scheduled to begin, after being informed that his participation has been “politicised”

title: Bank that had a humble beginning has more than 3,000 branches
content: Registered as a joint stock bank on November 20, 1936, in Madras, the financial institution was aimed at promoting overseas banking and facilitating foreign exchange operations. As of December 31, 2024, it had a customer base of 4 crore and 21,147 employees

title: American Airlines flight from New York to Delhi lands safely in Rome after security concern
content: Flight tracking website claims a bomb threat was the reason for the diversion but there has been official statement from the airline

title: Lawyers, judicial officers fail written test for posts of district judges
content: None of the candidates cleared the written test for the 2024 competitive examination for district judges in Orissa. Out of 366 eligible candidates, none scored the required marks to proceed to the interview round. The examination tested knowledge across various laws and required a 50% aggregate score in specific papers.

title: NASA to launch lunar lander ‘Athena’ with SpaceX Falcon 9 on Feb 26; know more
content: NASA's Nova-C lander, Athena, will launch to the Moon aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket on February 26, 2025. This mission is part of the Artemis program and the Commercial Lunar Payload Services, focusing on long-term lunar exploration and resource utilization. The mission will include scientific experiments and technology demonstrations to support future Moon and Mars explorations.

title: German elections 2025: What is AfD and why is it trending?
content: The Alternative for Germany party (AfD) emerged as the second-largest political force in Germany, securing around 20% of the vote. Despite efforts to halve its support, the AfD's anti-immigration stance resonated with many voters. However, coalition prospects look slim, with the CDU ruling out collaboration due to major policy differences.

title: Rapidly moving Australia to collide with Asia - what does this mean ?
content: Australia is moving north towards Asia at 2.8 inches per year. This gradual shift could cause significant geological changes and impact biodiversity. It has already affected GPS systems. It could also impact navigation systems, satellite maps, and infrastructure, necessitating ongoing recalibration to maintain accuracy for sectors like autonomous vehicles and aviation.

title: Kohli’s Masterclass: Another chase, another ton, another win
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. His clinical run-chase, characterized by calculated playing and minimizing risks, showcased his prowess. Kohli's fitness and strategic striking in the middle overs were key. He emphasized maintaining focus and energy, aiming to rest before facing New Zealand.

title: Harrowing time for commuters as snag hits ro-ro ferry

title: Build friendship among all groups: Mohan Bhagwat to RSS volunteers

title: Watch: Israeli jets that allegedly killed Nasrallah hover over his funeral gathering
content: Israeli warplanes circled over Beirut during Hezbollah leader Sheikh Hassan Nasrallah's funeral in a show of force. Defence Minister Israel Katz confirmed it as a message to those who threaten Israel. Nasrallah, killed in an Israeli airstrike, led Hezbollah for over three decades.

title: Who is Dan Bongino? Donald Trump’s pick for FBI deputy under Kash Patel
content: Dan Bongino, a former Secret Service agent and conservative commentator, has been named the new deputy director of the FBI by President Trump. Known for his law enforcement background and political commentary, Bongino's appointment alongside FBI Director Kash Patel marks a significant shift in the agency, emphasizing loyalty to Trump and commitment to traditional crime-fighting efforts.

title: 'Sharam karo bachon ko bully karte hue': Memes from IND-PAK
content: In a must-win match against India in the Champions Trophy, Pakistan started strong but faltered after key dismissals. Despite a 104-run third-wicket stand, they managed only 241 runs. India chased comfortably, bolstered by a century from Virat Kohli. Pakistani fans expressed disappointment and humour, emphasising the gap between the teams.

title: College basketball team’s road trip turns nightmare as bus catches fire
content: The Indiana University Indianapolis men's basketball team safely evacuated after their bus caught fire on the way back from a game against Northern Kentucky. No injuries were reported, but the team lost all their gear and some personal belongings.

title: Virat Kohli surpasses Ricky Ponting in all-time run-scorer list
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, cementing their place in the semifinals. Kohli's unbeaten 100 not only secured the win but also made him the third-highest run-scorer in international cricket, surpassing Ricky Ponting. He became the fastest to reach 14,000 ODI runs, continuing to set new records.

title: 6 dead, 2 injured as jeep carrying Maha Kumbh returnees collides with bus
content: A tragic road accident in Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, on Monday morning resulted in six fatalities when a vehicle collided with a bus. The identities of the victims are yet to be confirmed. Another accident occurred in Mauganj district on Sunday, killing three Maharashtra residents after attending the Mahakumbh. Emergency responders and authorities are probing the causes of both incidents.

title: Rs 7 crore timepiece! Hardik Pandya's watch steals the spotlight
content: Hardik Pandya’s impressive bowling helped India defeat Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025, but his $800,000 Richard Mille RM 27-02 watch also grabbed attention. The rare timepiece, designed for Rafael Nadal, features cutting-edge technology. Pandya's 2 for 31 performance, including Babar Azam's wicket, combined with Virat Kohli's masterclass sealed the win for India.

title: Who is Alice Weidel? Germany’s gay, far-right AfD leader
content: Alice Weidel, a gay woman with a Sri Lankan partner, leads Germany's far-right AfD, which opposes same-sex marriage and champions traditional values. Her leadership has bolstered the AfD's support. Despite criticism for her anti-immigration stance and controversial views, she remains influential in German politics, urging stricter immigration laws and a referendum on EU membership.

title: Jilted lover goes on rampage in Bengaluru, torches 3 cars & damages bike
content: In south Bengaluru, three cars were torched and a motorbike was severely damaged in a suspected act of revenge by a man identified as Rahul, a known criminal. The vehicles, belonging to a girl's family, were set on fire allegedly because the girl had distanced herself from Rahul, prompting him to act out violently.

title: CT Digest: Virat Kohli's masterclass sinks Pakistan; NZ eye semis
content: Virat Kohli's sensational unbeaten century led India to a commanding six-wicket win over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, placing them atop Group A. Kohli's innings, achieving a key milestone of 14,000 ODI runs, ensures India’s strong position. Attention now turns to the New Zealand vs Bangladesh match, pivotal for semifinal qualifications.

title: Top stock recommendations for the week starting February 24, 2025
content: Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd recommends Hindalco and UltraTech as top stock picks for the week of February 24, 2025. Hindalco showcases strong earnings growth and expansion plans, while UltraTech benefits from industry leadership, high utilization rates, and recovering cement demand.

title: Who is Friedrich Merz? The conservative set to become Germany's new chancellor
content: The Christian Democratic Union (CDU) is poised to win the German election, with Friedrich Merz set to become the new chancellor. The ruling Social Democrats are seeing a decline, while the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) is gaining ground. Merz, known for his firm stance on asylum-seekers and business background, aims to strengthen Europe's security.

title: Sag Awards 2025: Complete list of winners
content: The 31st Annual SAG Awards in Los Angeles celebrated exceptional performances in film and television. Timothée Chalamet and Demi Moore were among the big winners. 'A Complete Unknown' and 'Shōgun' took top honors in their respective categories. The star-studded event recognized outstanding achievements in acting.

title: Drones used in Manipur violence were procured from Delhi, Haryana: NIA
content: NIA has identified suppliers of drones used in attacks at Koutruk and Kadangband in Manipur last year. Mayank Sharma and Vikram Chaudhary provided the drones and accessories. Khaigoulen Kipgen collected them after paying a substantial amount. The attacks, executed by suspected Kuki militants, involved 40 bombs dropped via drones, resulting in one death and injuries.

title: Deported by US to Panama, 12 illegal migrants reach India
content: A group of 12 undocumented Indian immigrants deported from the US to Panama reached Delhi, facilitated by the International Organisation for Migration. This comes after the deportation of 332 others to Amritsar earlier this month. Cases have been registered against travel agents responsible for illegal facilitation.

title: Virat Kohli loves representing the country: Rohit Sharma

Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century drove India to victory, while bowlers like Kuldeep and Axar played a key role in restricting Pakistan to 241.

title: Trump administration fires 2,000 USAID workers, puts thousands on leave
content: The Trump administration has cut 2,000 positions at USAID and placed remaining staff on administrative leave after a federal court allowed the move. This decision is part of a larger effort to scale back USAID operations, which has already led to the closure of its headquarters and numerous global aid programs.

title: 'I bear responsibility': German chancellor Olaf Scholz on election defeat
content: Germany's national elections saw Olaf Scholz's SPD defeated, with Friedrich Merz's CDU/CSU alliance winning over 28% of the vote. The far-right AfD surged to second place with 20%, while coalition talks remain uncertain. The election results have raised concerns over Germany’s future direction, with significant implications for its defense policy and European unity.

title: Pope Francis develops 'initial, slight insufficiency' in kidney function
content: Pope Francis has demonstrated an initial, mild insufficiency in kidney function, as per a Vatican update. He remains alert and is receiving high-flow oxygen therapy. Since last evening, there have been no further respiratory crises, and his hemoglobin levels have risen following a transfusion. The condition is critical but stable with continuous monitoring.

title: 70 rescued from cybercrime hub in Myanmar, await return to India
content: Around 70 Indians, including five women, were rescued from a cybercrime hub in Myanmar and moved to Thailand by Myanmar’s armed forces. The victims, hailing from various Indian states, had been coerced into cybercriminal activities, and authorities are now coordinating their return to India.

title: Virat Kohli is always hungry for runs: Shreyas Iyer
content: India secured a crucial victory against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy, boosting their semifinal chances. Shreyas Iyer's pivotal 56 runs and Kohli's century were key contributors. Iyer praised the team's strategy and spinners' performance while dismissing injury concerns for Rohit Sharma and Mohammed Shami.

title: 'We have achieved something historic': Germany's AfD celebrates record gains
content: Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party achieved a historic milestone, surging to over 20% in national election results, trailing only the CDU/CSU alliance. Chancellor Olaf Scholz's SPD faced a significant setback, finishing third with just over 16%, while AfD leaders challenge mainstream parties on future cooperation.

title: Germany elections: Friedrich Merz claims victory for his conservatives
content: German elections see opposition leader Friedrich Merz claiming victory, with the far-right Alternative for Germany achieving its strongest showing since World War II. The results indicate complications in forming a coalition, with potential partners required for Merz to secure governance.

The film, chronicling Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj's life, earned ₹44 crore on its second Saturday and ₹40 crore on its second Sunday. It also received praise from Prime Minister Narendra Modi, adding to its soaring popularity.

title: Outflows from FIIs touch Rs 1.1 lakh crore in 2025
content: Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold Rs 1.1 lakh crore in Indian equities in 2025, causing a 4% decline in Nifty year-to-date. High valuations and weak corporate earnings led to profit booking, with China's market gains drawing FIIs away from Indian stocks.

title: 'Brainless and clueless': Akhtar and Akram slam Pak management after loss to India
content: Shoaib Akhtar and Wasim Akram criticised Pakistan's team management after their six-wicket loss to India in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Akhtar described the management as 'brainless and clueless' for poor team selection, while Akram emphasised the need for drastic changes to rebuild the team. Both expressed concern over Pakistan's bowling performance and leadership.

title: Telangana tunnel collapse: Minister says chances of survival 'very remote'
content: Eight individuals remain trapped in the SLBC tunnel after its partial collapse in Telangana. Despite rescue efforts involving rat miners and equipment, the chances of survival appear very slim due to significant debris and lack of oxygen. The operation may take three to four days.

title: Kumbh pilgrims returning with skin ailments: Ranchi docs
content: Recent reports from CPCB and NGT highlight poor water quality at the Kumbh Mela, leading to a surge in skin ailments among returning pilgrims. Ranchi's dermatologists report a sharp increase in infections like rashes and fungal issues. High coliform levels, indicating severe contamination, are suspected causes. Poor sanitation and water pollution are major factors contributing to these health problems.

title: Ghaziabad family strip, molest woman over dowry; 6 held
content: Pilibhit police booked six members of a Ghaziabad-based family for allegedly torturing a 27-year-old woman over dowry. The woman claimed her husband and in-laws demanded Rs 10 lakh and a luxury car despite receiving a large dowry initially. After her daughter's birth, the situation worsened, leading her to return to her parents.

title: Infosys co-founder: You can have all the AIs in the world, but ...
content: Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani highlighted that artificial intelligence will not replace core human traits like empathy, leadership, creativity, and collaboration. Speaking at an AIMA event, he emphasized the importance of developing adaptable skills and predicted significant AI advancements in India in the coming year.

title: Boy, 8, killed by neighbours after kids’ spat in Meerut
content: In Hapur's Garh Mukhteshwar, a minor quarrel between children led to the abduction and murder of an eight-year-old boy, Krishna Kumar. His neighbor's family kidnapped and killed him in response to a playing dispute. Three neighbors, including Deepak Kumar, have been arrested after the body was discovered on their terrace.

title: Buffalo crashes into wedding in Gujarat, 2 injured
content: Two men in Salabatpura were charged for failing to control a buffalo that invaded a wedding venue, causing chaos and injuring two young girls. Authorities stated that the incident occurred due to negligent handling by Naeem Kureshi, who brought the buffalo but lost control as he was unloading it.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk gives ‘bankruptcy’ warning for California
content: Elon Musk warns California could face bankruptcy without significant changes, citing concerns about high government spending and business regulations. Musk moved Tesla's headquarters to Texas due to California's challenges. He also emphasized that the U.S. needs drastic budget cuts, stressing it's essential to avoid national bankruptcy.

title: Virat Kohli on what it means to play against Pakistan - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's candid reflection on his century against Pakistan highlights the dual-edged nature of his favorite cover drive shot, which is both a weakness and a scoring tool. In the ICC Champions Trophy match, he emphasizes the balance between minimizing risks and ensuring team victory, especially in high-stakes matches against archrivals.

title: 'Make up your mind on what kind of ties you want,' Jaishankar tells Dhaka
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar urged Bangladesh to decide on the nature of their relationship with India, highlighting issues of blame and minority attacks. He emphasized the importance of clear intentions for the future while acknowledging the historical ties between the two nations.

title: India’s GDP may take 0.1-0.6% hit from US tariff moves
content: India's GDP may be impacted by proposed US tariffs raising by an estimated 0.1 to 0.6 percentage points, as per Goldman Sachs analysis. The potential rise in tariffs by 6.5 to 11.5 percentage points on Indian imports may significantly affect India's trade dynamics with the US.

title: IITian Baba gets message from MBA Chaiwaala & T20 World Cup 'Panauti'
content: Prafull Billore, the founder of MBA Chaiwala, humorously challenges IITian Baba's prediction about India's victory over Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. Known for his viral 'Panauti' memes, Billore's playful antics on social media have continued to entertain fans amidst India's cricketing triumphs.

title: 'Dil ke armaan ...': Shoaib Malik expresses frustration with song - Watch
content: Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik expressed his frustration after Pakistan's six-wicket loss to India by singing a classic song during a panel discussion. The legendary pace trio of Wasim Akram, Waqar Younis and Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan's poor batting and lack of discipline. Pakistan are now on the brink of elimination from the Champions Trophy.

title: Tangra deaths: Why cops are not convinced by Dey brothers’ suicide story
content: Prasun Dey, soon to be discharged from the hospital, will join his brother Pranay at NRS Medical College for questioning. Investigations focus on whether they force-fed poison to Priyamvada and details surrounding their planned suicide. Prasun's recovery is critical for the probe as police aim to fill gaps in the case.

title: Germany turns right: Election results explained in 9 graphics
content: Voters turned out in record numbers for the German election. Here’s a look in charts at the wins and losses, seats in parliament, possible coalition outcomes and voter demographics.

title: 'Kohinoor' Virat Kohli will score another 10 to 15 hundreds: Sidhu
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu is confident that Virat Kohli will continue his career for another 2-3 years following his recent performance. Kohli's unbeaten century against Pakistan highlights his resilience and determination, setting expectations for more centuries in the coming years.

title: Watch: How Italian jets escorted American Airlines flight to Rome after bomb threat
content: A bomb threat on an American Airlines flight from New York to Delhi led to its diversion to Rome, where it was escorted by Italian fighter jets and inspected. The threat was deemed non-credible, but security protocols necessitated the diversion. The aircraft was cleared and re-departed after an overnight stay for crew rest.

title: Who are the 10 people PM Modi chose to lead the fight against obesity?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi nominated ten prominent figures to lead a campaign against obesity and excessive edible oil consumption. This initiative follows his 'Mann Ki Baat' address urging a 10% reduction in oil intake. Nominations include influential personalities like Anand Mahindra, Mirabai Chanu, and Sudha Murty, aiming to spread health awareness and motivate others to join the movement.

title: Sensex crashes 800 points; why stock market is falling today
content: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, plunged in trade on Monday. While BSE Sensex tanked over 800 points, Nifty50 went below 22,600.

title: Lawyers, judicial officers fail written test for posts of district judges
content: None of the candidates cleared the written test for the 2024 competitive examination for district judges in Orissa. Out of 366 eligible candidates, none scored the required marks to proceed to the interview round. The examination tested knowledge across various laws and required a 50% aggregate score in specific papers.

title: NASA to launch lunar lander ‘Athena’ with SpaceX Falcon 9 on Feb 26; know more
content: NASA's Nova-C lander, Athena, will launch to the Moon aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket on February 26, 2025. This mission is part of the Artemis program and the Commercial Lunar Payload Services, focusing on long-term lunar exploration and resource utilization. The mission will include scientific experiments and technology demonstrations to support future Moon and Mars explorations.

title: German elections 2025: What is AfD and why is it trending?
content: The Alternative for Germany party (AfD) emerged as the second-largest political force in Germany, securing around 20% of the vote. Despite efforts to halve its support, the AfD's anti-immigration stance resonated with many voters. However, coalition prospects look slim, with the CDU ruling out collaboration due to major policy differences.

title: Rapidly moving Australia to collide with Asia - what does this mean ?
content: Australia is moving north towards Asia at 2.8 inches per year. This gradual shift could cause significant geological changes and impact biodiversity. It has already affected GPS systems. It could also impact navigation systems, satellite maps, and infrastructure, necessitating ongoing recalibration to maintain accuracy for sectors like autonomous vehicles and aviation.

title: Kohli’s Masterclass: Another chase, another ton, another win
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. His clinical run-chase, characterized by calculated playing and minimizing risks, showcased his prowess. Kohli's fitness and strategic striking in the middle overs were key. He emphasized maintaining focus and energy, aiming to rest before facing New Zealand.

title: Watch: Israeli jets that allegedly killed Nasrallah hover over his funeral gathering
content: Israeli warplanes circled over Beirut during Hezbollah leader Sheikh Hassan Nasrallah's funeral in a show of force. Defence Minister Israel Katz confirmed it as a message to those who threaten Israel. Nasrallah, killed in an Israeli airstrike, led Hezbollah for over three decades.

title: Who is Dan Bongino? Donald Trump’s pick for FBI deputy under Kash Patel
content: Dan Bongino, a former Secret Service agent and conservative commentator, has been named the new deputy director of the FBI by President Trump. Known for his law enforcement background and political commentary, Bongino's appointment alongside FBI Director Kash Patel marks a significant shift in the agency, emphasizing loyalty to Trump and commitment to traditional crime-fighting efforts.

title: 'Sharam karo bachon ko bully karte hue': Memes from IND-PAK
content: In a must-win match against India in the Champions Trophy, Pakistan started strong but faltered after key dismissals. Despite a 104-run third-wicket stand, they managed only 241 runs. India chased comfortably, bolstered by a century from Virat Kohli. Pakistani fans expressed disappointment and humour, emphasising the gap between the teams.

title: College basketball team’s road trip turns nightmare as bus catches fire
content: The Indiana University Indianapolis men's basketball team safely evacuated after their bus caught fire on the way back from a game against Northern Kentucky. No injuries were reported, but the team lost all their gear and some personal belongings.

title: Virat Kohli surpasses Ricky Ponting in all-time run-scorer list
content: Virat Kohli's 51st ODI century led India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, cementing their place in the semifinals. Kohli's unbeaten 100 not only secured the win but also made him the third-highest run-scorer in international cricket, surpassing Ricky Ponting. He became the fastest to reach 14,000 ODI runs, continuing to set new records.

title: 6 dead, 2 injured as jeep carrying Maha Kumbh returnees collides with bus
content: A tragic road accident in Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, on Monday morning resulted in six fatalities when a vehicle collided with a bus. The identities of the victims are yet to be confirmed. Another accident occurred in Mauganj district on Sunday, killing three Maharashtra residents after attending the Mahakumbh. Emergency responders and authorities are probing the causes of both incidents.

title: Rs 7 crore timepiece! Hardik Pandya's watch steals the spotlight
content: Hardik Pandya’s impressive bowling helped India defeat Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025, but his $800,000 Richard Mille RM 27-02 watch also grabbed attention. The rare timepiece, designed for Rafael Nadal, features cutting-edge technology. Pandya's 2 for 31 performance, including Babar Azam's wicket, combined with Virat Kohli's masterclass sealed the win for India.

title: Who is Alice Weidel? Germany’s gay, far-right AfD leader
content: Alice Weidel, a gay woman with a Sri Lankan partner, leads Germany's far-right AfD, which opposes same-sex marriage and champions traditional values. Her leadership has bolstered the AfD's support. Despite criticism for her anti-immigration stance and controversial views, she remains influential in German politics, urging stricter immigration laws and a referendum on EU membership.

title: Jilted lover goes on rampage in Bengaluru, torches 3 cars & damages bike
content: In south Bengaluru, three cars were torched and a motorbike was severely damaged in a suspected act of revenge by a man identified as Rahul, a known criminal. The vehicles, belonging to a girl's family, were set on fire allegedly because the girl had distanced herself from Rahul, prompting him to act out violently.

title: CT Digest: Virat Kohli's masterclass sinks Pakistan; NZ eye semis
content: Virat Kohli's sensational unbeaten century led India to a commanding six-wicket win over Pakistan in the ICC Champions Trophy, placing them atop Group A. Kohli's innings, achieving a key milestone of 14,000 ODI runs, ensures India’s strong position. Attention now turns to the New Zealand vs Bangladesh match, pivotal for semifinal qualifications.

title: Top stock recommendations for the week starting February 24, 2025
content: Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd recommends Hindalco and UltraTech as top stock picks for the week of February 24, 2025. Hindalco showcases strong earnings growth and expansion plans, while UltraTech benefits from industry leadership, high utilization rates, and recovering cement demand.

title: Who is Friedrich Merz? The conservative set to become Germany's new chancellor
content: The Christian Democratic Union (CDU) is poised to win the German election, with Friedrich Merz set to become the new chancellor. The ruling Social Democrats are seeing a decline, while the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) is gaining ground. Merz, known for his firm stance on asylum-seekers and business background, aims to strengthen Europe's security.

title: Sag Awards 2025: Complete list of winners
content: The 31st Annual SAG Awards in Los Angeles celebrated exceptional performances in film and television. Timothée Chalamet and Demi Moore were among the big winners. 'A Complete Unknown' and 'Shōgun' took top honors in their respective categories. The star-studded event recognized outstanding achievements in acting.

title: Drones used in Manipur violence were procured from Delhi, Haryana: NIA
content: NIA has identified suppliers of drones used in attacks at Koutruk and Kadangband in Manipur last year. Mayank Sharma and Vikram Chaudhary provided the drones and accessories. Khaigoulen Kipgen collected them after paying a substantial amount. The attacks, executed by suspected Kuki militants, involved 40 bombs dropped via drones, resulting in one death and injuries.

title: Deported by US to Panama, 12 illegal migrants reach India
content: A group of 12 undocumented Indian immigrants deported from the US to Panama reached Delhi, facilitated by the International Organisation for Migration. This comes after the deportation of 332 others to Amritsar earlier this month. Cases have been registered against travel agents responsible for illegal facilitation.

title: Virat Kohli loves representing the country: Rohit Sharma
